Lobbyist Name: The Union of Retail ,Bar and Administrative Workers
Specific Details: Transposition of the EU Directive on Adequate Minimum Wages (AMW) - Respect At Work Campaign
Subject Matter: Transposition of the EU Directive on Adequate Minimum Wages (AMW) - Respect At Work Campaign
Intended Results: An outright ban on union-busting. Introduce robust protections for union Reps so that they cant be victimised, discriminated against or dismissed for their union activity. Introduce separate robust anti penalisation protections for union members so that they cant be victimisedfor joining a union. Introduce prescribed facilities for union Repsso that they have the means to discharge their functions. The right of workers to access trade union Reps in the workplace.
Lobbying Activities: Email from Mandate Greg Caffrey to Paul Murphy TD (PBP-S) in relation to AMW EU Directive and the Abolishment of the Sub Minimum Wage Bill.|Email|2-5::Teams Meeting 5 June 2024 with Mandate Greg Caffrey, Ken Reilly, John O'Donnell, Gerard Halligan and Paul Murphy TD (PBP-S) regarding organisation of Public Demonstration for Inter Trade Unions and Like Minded Organisations to support ISSU, USI, ICTU & DCTU.|Virtual Meeting|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Lorraine O'Brien, Mandate Interim General Secretary - Greg Caffrey, Mandate
Grassroots directive: To discuss the AMW EU Directive Transposition into Irish Statue by November 2024, the Abolishment of the Sub Minimum Wage and to seek support on Mandates Respect at Work Campaign. Mandate are seeking to mark the re-reading of this bill by being in attendance at the Joint Oireachtas Committee ETE Sub-Minimum Wage Hearing 10 July 2024 and seek support for a Public Demo for Inter Trade Unions and Like Minded Organisations to support ISSU, USI, ICTU & DCTU: Leinster House 19 June 2024.
